org.assertj.swing.fixture
Class AbstractJComponentFixture<S,T extends JComponent,D extends JComponentDriver>

java.lang.Object
  org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractComponentFixture<S,T,D>
      org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJComponentFixture<S,T,D>
Type Parameters:
S - used to simulate "self types." For more information please read "Emulating 'self types' using Java Generics to simplify fluent API implementation."
T - the type of JComponent that this fixture can manage.
D - the type of JComponentDriver that this fixture uses internally.
All Implemented Interfaces:
JComponentFixture<S>, MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture, JFileChooserFixture, JMenuItemFixture, JPopupMenuFixture, JProgressBarFixture, JTableHeaderFixture
public abstract class AbstractJComponentFixture<S,T extends JComponent,D extends JComponentDriver>
extends AbstractComponentFixture<S,T,D>
implements JComponentFixture<S>

Supports functional testing of JComponents.

Author:
Alex Ruiz

                                 Robot robot,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Class<? extends T> type)
Creates a new AbstractJComponentFixture.

Parameters:
selfType - the "self type."
robot - performs simulation of user events on a JComponent.
type - the type of the JComponent to find using the given Robot.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if robot is null.
NullPointerException - if type is null.
ComponentLookupException - if a matching component could not be found.
ComponentLookupException - if more than one matching component is found.

Parameters:

Returns:

Throws:
